summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney Alison Moe and attorney Jeff Jocks regarding a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence reveals that Interlochen's records show no tuition payments by Epstein or his entities, as their retention policy only covers seven years.

persons.name: Alison Moe
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York leading the inquiry and subpoena for records from Interlochen Center for the Arts related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeff Jocks
persons.role: Attorney for Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts, responding to the DOJ subpoena and confirming no records of Epstein tuition payments exist due to the institution's 7-year retention policy.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.context: Attorney cc'd on the email chain, involved in the response to the subpoena regarding Interlochen's records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation; the subpoena seeks records of any tuition payments he or his entities made to Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-conspirator and associate of Jeffrey Epstein; the subpoena also seeks information related to her.

connections.description: Prosecutor issuing subpoena to attorney representing the institution being investigated; professional correspondence regarding document production.
Both attorneys involved in responding to the DOJ subpoena on behalf of Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Both named as subjects in the subpoena for records from Interlochen Center for the Arts.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Interlochen
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Alison Moe serves a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Follow-up Inquiry on Tuition Payments
events.description: Alison Moe follows up to confirm whether Interlochen's document production included all records of tuition payments made by Epstein or his entities.

events.title: Final Response from Interlochen
events.description: Jeff Jocks confirms Interlochen has no records of Epstein tuition payments, as they only retain payment information for seven years.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
Interlochen's attorney confirmed the institution only keeps tuition payment records for seven years, and no records reflected payments by Epstein or his entities.
The email chain shows the investigation was active in 2020, focusing on financial transactions and potential benefits provided by Epstein to students.
The correspondence highlights the DOJ's efforts to trace Epstein's financial activities and connections to educational institutions.
The subpoena was kept confidential as requested by the prosecution.
